title: Census of Quirinius – registration & initial taxation
description: Roman governor Publius Sulpicius Quirinius orders a census; Jewish landowners must register in ancestral towns, causing temporary displacement.

title: Jews expelled from Rome by Tiberius
description: Tiberius expels the Jewish community of Rome to Sardinia after disturbances linked to proselytism.

title: Forced settlement on Sardinia
description: 4,000 adult Jewish males deported to Sardinia for compulsory military service in malaria-control units.

title: Claudius restricts Jewish assembly in Rome
description: Emperor Claudius issues an edict forbidding Jews to assemble and expels the most vocal agitators.

title: Post-war confiscations & temple tax levy
description: After the fall of Jerusalem, Vespasian imposes the Fiscus Judaicus; land and temple treasures confiscated; survivors dispersed.

title: Mass enslavement & forced resettlement
description: 97,000 captives sold at auction; many shipped to Egypt, Cyrene and Italy.

title: Diaspora Revolt aftermath – Cyrenaica & Cyprus
description: After the revolt, Hadrian forbids Jews to reside in Cyrene; survivors relocated elsewhere in the empire.

title: Final expulsion from Judaea after Bar Kokhba
description: Hadrian bans circumcision and renames the province Syria Palaestina; surviving Jewish population expelled from Jerusalem and its environs.
